required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Fertility Hormone Patterns and Pregnancy Rates.
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Fertility Hormone Patterns and Pregnancy Rates.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if certain patterns of hormone levels during the menstrual cycle are correlated with different pregnancy outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
Proov tests are fertility tracking tests. They are used for monitoring ovulation at home, and are able to measure one or more hormones. These hormones can predict and confirm ovulation. Tracking these hormones can help a woman understand if she is ovulating, and can help to identify problems that could be preventing pregnancy.
After giving permission to access your testing history collected in the Proov app from March 2020 to April 2022, you will complete an online survey about your fertility test results and pregnancy status. You will also be asked information regarding your age, race, smoking status, and BMI. Your test results logged in the Proov app will be shared automatically. You will need 10-20 minutes to fill out the fertility survey.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Two menstrual cycle, up to 45 days each
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire used to assess if positive Proov test strips measuring urine PDG correlate with increased rates of self reported pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: self reported first trimester pregnancy loss
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire used to assess if negative Proov test strips measuring urine PDG correlate with increased rates of self reported first trimester pregnancy loss

arm_group.arm_group_label: Proov test strip users that record results with the Proov app
arm_group.description: Participants using Proov test strips along with the Proov app who have logged at least one complete cycle will be asked to complete an online survey about fertility test results and current/previous pregnancy status. They will also be asked cycle history (irregular vs regular, cycle length), fertility testing (partners semen analysis results, AMH level, HSG results), possible fertility medications taken or prescribed, age, race, smoking status, and BMI.

intervention.description: Rapid response urine PdG and LH test strips, Proov
intervention.arm_group_label: Proov test strip users that record results with the Proov app

study_pop.textblock: Females age 18 - no limit who are using, or have used, the Proov hormone test strips and the Proov app for at least one full cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Female
2. Age 18 - no limit
3. Have completed one full cycle using the Proov app
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Male
2. Have not completed one full cycle using the Proov app
